title: Body Camera Footage (7/30/2022)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Body Camera Footage (7/30/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident:


Incident Date: July 30, 2022
Location: Apple River, Wisconsin
Offender: Nicolae Miu
Victim: Isaac Schuman

I am requesting all relevant footage, including any interactions between the police and witnesses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ivan LEE

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Treasury)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: California Public Records Request: mobile device forensic tools

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Public Records Request: mobile device forensic tools
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records regarding the thousand oaks police Department’s use of mobile device forensic tools (MDFTs). 
This includes any software, hardware, process, or service that is capable of any of the following:
• extracting any data from a mobile device,
• recovering deleted files from a mobile device, or
• bypassing mobile device passwords, locks, or other security features.
Examples of MDFTs include, but are not limited to, products or services offered by vendors such 
as Cellebrite, Grayshift, Oxygen Forensics, BlackBag Technologies, Magnet Forensics, MSAB, 
AccessData, Paraben, Katana Forensics, BK Forensics, and Guidance Software/OpenText. 
I specifically requests the following records under the California public records act 
1. Purchase Records and Agreements: Any and all records reflecting an agreement for purchase, 
acquisition, or license of MDFTs, or permission to use, test, or evaluate MDFTs since 2015. 
2. Records of Use: Any and all records describing the Department’s use of MDFTs since 2015.
a. In particular, we seek records reflecting the department’s aggregate use of MDFTs. For 
example, monthly reports that reflect the total number of MDFT cases for each month, 
broken down by type of crime, and number and type of phones, and number and type of 
other devices.
i. Please specify any instances where the department used Cellebrite Advanced Services, 
or otherwise transferred possession of a device or its contents to a vendor for off-site 
processing, including Regional Computer Forensics Laboratories.
ii. Please include any instances of forensic examination of a device (e.g. using JTAG or 
chip-off processes) that may not involve a vendor’s product. 
3. Policies Governing Use: Any and all records regarding policies and guidelines governing the 
use of MDFTs, including but not limited to: training materials regarding their operation, 
restrictions on when they may be used, limitations on retention and use of collected data, 
security measures taken to protect stored and in-transit data, guidance on when a warrant or 
other legal process must be obtained, and guidance on when the existence and use of MDFTs 
may be revealed to the public, criminal defendants, or judges.
Due to the ubiquity of mobile devices, law enforcement sees the data stored on mobile devices, 
like cellphones, as key sources of evidence for investigations. However, mobile devices can 
contain large amounts of people’s sensitive and private information, much of which may be 
irrelevant to a given investigation. As the Supreme Court recognized in Riley v. 
California, “[o]ne of the most notable distinguishing features of modern cellphones is their 
immense storage capacity.” As such, forensic searches of mobile devices are often highly invasive, 
and we believe that such searches by law enforcement are increasingly common. 
Mobile device forensic tools (MDFTs) are used by law enforcement to extract data from mobile 
devices. In some cases, if the data on the mobile device is encrypted, some MDFTs can help law 
enforcement circumvent a device’s security features in order to access otherwise inaccessible 
data. These capabilities have been the subject of broad public debate, for example, in the 
aftermath of the high-profile San Bernardino shooting in 2015. Whether or not devices are 
encrypted, law enforcement’s use of MDFTs is an issue of significant public interest. 
Currently, there is a considerable lack of public information available regarding how local 
law enforcement agencies use MDFTs, and the policies and procedures that govern such 
use. The public is entitled to understand the Department’s activities and capabilities with 
respect to MDFTs, and this request seeks to further the public’s understanding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mr. adonis gaynor

title: Seeking Evidence Supporting Finding of Fact that the Attack on the USS Liberty was "Mistaken Identity"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Seeking Evidence Supporting Finding of Fact that the Attack on the USS Liberty was "Mistaken Identity"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the ship was attacked by the IDF on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

The Report of the US Navy Court of Inquiry convened to look into all aspects of the June 8, 1967 attack on our ship contains a Finding of Fact claiming “Available evidence combines to indicate the attack on LIBERTY on 8 June was in fact a case of mistaken identity.”

We are requesting to be provided with all the “available evidence” included in the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report (a requirement per the Manual of the Judge Advcate General) that supports that Finding of Fact.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Officer Stiltner of the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission records of assessment and arrests for impairment

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Officer Stiltner of the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission records of assessment and arrests for impairment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

During a recent arrest, Officer Stiltner made several comments regarding his expertise and experience related to assessing and determining impairment due to drugs and/or alcohol, specifically related to boating. Please provide a record of when Officer Stiltner has performed field tests on suspects during his career with your agency and if those tests resulted in an arrest. In addition, please provide the results of those arrests (e.g. charges dismissed, guilty, etc) for any cases that are not currently open, and/or sufficient details to obtain this information from relevant public court records. Please also provide any subject matter specific training and/or proficiency testing Officer Stiltner has had in this area including the results of testing, if it was completed or any relevant scores as applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lee Clemens

title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Dannon Bryant (10/31/2023)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Dannon Bryant (10/31/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident: 

Incident Date: October 31, 2023
Location: W. Desert Inn Rd, Las Vegas, NV
Victim Name: Dannon Bryant

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. 

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Curtis Smith (5/4/2023)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Curtis Smith (5/4/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident: 

Incident Date: May 4, 2023
Location: 1200 block of Dauphin Street, Philadelphia, PA
Victim Name: Curtis Smith

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. 

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun
